medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Intermittent RUQ abdominal pain radiating to the R scapula for the last several weeks. Pain onset usually after dinner, with recurrence last night after dinner. The pain has become constant and increasing in intensity. Prior to pain medications, the pain was rated as severe, now it is tolerable. Patient has experienced nausea and retching without vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD, Major depression, Insomnia, Obesity; History of gastric bypass and revision to Roux-en-Y.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of pancreatic cancer. Mother with heart disease.
